intro: Barbarea vulgaris subsp. praecox, commonly known as early bittercress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are kidney-shaped with a hairy surface, and its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters. It produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated fields.
